text: today I'm making a recipe that was a
huge hit when I was developing it here
in the kitchen it's yoki with cheese and
arugula and it could not be easier
I have already in the pot that I'm gonna
cook my gnocchi soft-boiled some eggs
because this gets served with a
delicious sort of creamy egg at the end
but I just put them into the pot it was
a clean shell obviously watch the show
because you're going to cook your
gnocchi in the same pot you want to make
sure it's clean slice one white onion
very thinly Oh to cook the egg bring
your water to a boil make sure the shell
is clean and then add it to the pot and
cook for 6 minutes then take it out and
run it under cold water to something
that's how you get a soft-boiled egg so
that's the onion I'm gonna drop my
gnocchi now it's 1 pound fresh gnocchi
you can also use the frozen kind let
that cook for about 1 and 1/2 minutes
you can give that a stir
salted boiling water well that's coming
back to a boil this is one bunch of
arugula that I have washed and dried for
the arugula you'll want to remove the
top stems you certainly won't have those
if you buy the 5 ounce package of baby
arugula but I like a nice hearty arugula
if you can find it use that but you will
want to remove the stems and then chop
it into it doesn't really matter but you
don't want them in long strands when
you're eating it it makes it difficult
what's your little component once the
gnocchi start to float you can add the
peas it's 1 and 1/2 cups of peas you can
use fresh but you can also use frozen
it's totally fine I love frozen peas and
then just stir that around return the
pot to a boil if you're using fresh peas
you might take another 20 seconds on top
of that before you add your arugula you
just add the arugula stir it in and then
drain the whole thing your Rugal it just
needs to wilt down you do not need to
cook it more than that save 3/4 with a
cup of pasta water and then drain
so in the same pot I mean you could do
it in a separate pot but I'm just gonna
do it right here in the same pot you
will melt two tablespoons of unsalted
butter and add your onion you're going
to saute that just a little bit melt it
down season with some salt and pepper
put some of that water out of those
onions get them nice and translucent
when your onions are translucent add a
third of a cup of heavy cream also add a
quarter of a cup of that pasta water you
may need a little bit more later so
don't throw it away yet and two ounces
of grated Parmesan cheese about 3/4 of a
cup stir this around to make like a
creamy sauce and then immediately add
your drained mixture he's the arugula
yoki it smells like an alfredo sauce in
here that's sort of what you're making
and then just stir everything around to
coat and then it's done that's it it's
so fragrant oh my gosh all right a
little bit more of this pepper and then
it will be served with a soft-boiled
eggs so serve it up if you feel like
it's not creamy enough anymore it starts
drying out you can stir in some of that
pasta water I feel like mine's doing
okay right now so I don't need to the
egg is optional of course we don't enjoy
that sort of thing but it adds a little
layer of excellence I think put into it
a fresh grating of cheese maybe a little
bit on top
another sprinkle of black pepper and
dinner is served
I'd say that's basically as good as any
restaurant and you made it at home enjoy
if you like recipes like this and you
want more make sure to click like and
subscribe because we have plenty more
where this came from
